explanation: To determine whether serve_simple_form violates the MISRA rule about well-formed for loops we must inspect any for loops that could affect or be affected by this function. Although serve_simple_form has no for loop itself, the MISRA text requires that the behaviour of a for-loop body include the behaviour of any functions called from that body and that loop counters/objects modified by called functions be considered. Therefore we need the implementations (or at least signatures and side‑effect behaviour) of all functions called directly by serve_simple_form and the functions those call (one level as shown in the static call graph), because any ill-formed for loop in those functions or side effects on objects that could serve as loop counters might be relevant when those functions are used in loop contexts elsewhere. Specifically:
